body.body: Bleed mice by aspirating blood from the heart: Insert a 24G needle, on a 1ml syringe, below the rib cage in the center, directed slightly to the left and downwards at an angle of about 15-20<sup>o</sup> to the surface
Enucleate eyes and put in complete medium in Petri dish for immediate retinal isolation.
Under a dissecting microscope cut along the limbus of the eye and carefully remove the lens and cornea; peel the retina off carefully and cut off the attachment at the optic nerve.

Mince retina tissue in collagenase/DNase digestion buffer


Buffer: Complete medium containing collagenase \(1mg/ml) + DNase \(10ug/ml)
Incubate retina in DNAse buffer at 37°C for 3hrs.
Pipette cells intermittently \(every 30 or 60 minutes) using 10 ml pipette.
After 3 hrs quench digestion reaction with 5-10 fold volume 10% FBS in medium.
Fill tube with medium and centrifuge at 1200rpm for 10minutes
Isolate naive syngeneic CD4+ T-helper cells \(>95%)

Culture the naïve T cells in medium containing anti-CD3/anti-CD28 Abs under TH17 polarizing condition \[TGF-β1 \(10ng/ml), IL-6 \(10ng/ml) anti-IFNγ \(10 µg/ml) and anti-IL-4 \(10µg/ml) Abs) for 48 hours
Add differentiating TH17 cells to freshly isolated retina cells \(1 TH17 cell: 5 retina cells)
Propagate co-culture for additional 48 hours under the TH17 polarizing condition in the presence or absence of 10µg/ml anti-IL-27p28 Abs
Controls: retinal cells alone; Differentiating TH17 cells alone.
Add PMA and Ionomycin for last 5 hours and Golgistop for last 1 hour as described above into the cultures.
Perform four-color cell surface/intracellular staining using antibodies against CD4, IL-17, IFN-γ, and CD44 and isotype control antibodies.
